013package org.apache.juneau.objecttools;
014
015import java.lang.reflect.*;
016import java.util.*;
017
018import org.apache.juneau.*;
019import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
020import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
021
022/**
023 * POJO model viewer.
024 *
025 * <p>
026 *    This class is designed to extract properties from collections of maps or beans.
027 * </p>
028 *
029 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
030 * <p class='bjava'>
031 *    MyBean[] <jv>arrayOfBeans</jv> = ...;
032 *    ObjectViewer <jv>viewer</jv> = ObjectViewer.<jsm>create</jsm>();
033 *
034 *    <jc>// Returns the 'foo' and 'bar' properties extracted into a list of maps.</jc>
035 *    List&lt;Map&gt; <jv>result</jv> = <jv>viewer</jv>.run(<jv>arrayOfBeans</jv>, <js>"foo,bar"</js>);
036 * </p>
037 * <p>
038 *    The tool can be used against the following data types:
039 * </p>
040 * <ul>
041 *    <li>Arrays/collections of maps or beans.
042 *    <li>Singular maps or beans.
043 * </ul>
044 *
045 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
046 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ObjectTools">Object Tools</a>
047
048 * </ul>
049 */
050@SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
051public final class ObjectViewer implements ObjectTool<ViewArgs> {
052
053   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
054   // Static
055   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
056
057   /**
058    * Default reusable searcher.
059    */
060   public static final ObjectViewer DEFAULT = new ObjectViewer();
061
062   /**
063    * Static creator.
064    *
065    * @return A new {@link ObjectViewer} object.
066    */
067   public static ObjectViewer create() {
068      return new ObjectViewer();
069   }
070
071   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
072   // Instance
073   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
074
075   /**
076    * Runs this viewer on the specified collection or array of objects.
077    *
078    * @param input The input.  Must be an array or collection.
079    * @param args The view args.  See {@link ViewArgs} for format.
080    * @return The extracted properties from the collection of objects.
081    */
082   public List<Map> run(Object input, String args) {
083      return (List<Map>)run(BeanContext.DEFAULT_SESSION, input, ViewArgs.create(args));
084   }
085
086   /**
087    * Runs this viewer on a singleton object.
088    *
089    * @param input The input.  Must be a singleton object.
090    * @param args The view args.  See {@link ViewArgs} for format.
091    * @return The extracted properties from the object.
092    */
093   public Map runSingle(Object input, String args) {
094      return (Map)run(BeanContext.DEFAULT_SESSION, input, ViewArgs.create(args));
095   }
096
097   @Override /* ObjectTool */
098   public Object run(BeanSession session, Object input, ViewArgs args) {
099
100      if (input == null)
101         return null;
102
103      List<String> view = args.getView();
104      ClassMeta type = session.getClassMetaForObject(input);
105
106      if (type.isBeanMap())
107         return new DelegateBeanMap(((BeanMap)input).getBean(), session).filterKeys(view);
108      if (type.isMap())
109         return new DelegateMap((Map)input, session).filterKeys(view);
110      if (type.isBean())
111         return new DelegateBeanMap(input, session).filterKeys(view);
112
113      ArrayList<Object> l = null;
114
115      if (type.isArray()) {
116         int size = Array.getLength(input);
117         l = Utils.listOfSize(size);
118         for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)
119            l.add(Array.get(input, i));
120      } else if (type.isCollection()) {
121         Collection c = (Collection)input;
122         l = Utils.listOfSize(c.size());
123         List<Object> l2 = l;
124         c.forEach(x -> l2.add(x));
125      } else {
126         return input;
127      }
128
129      for (ListIterator li = l.listIterator(); li.hasNext();) {
130         Object o = li.next();
131         ClassMeta cm2 = session.getClassMetaForObject(o);
132
133         if (cm2 == null)
134            o = null;
135         else if (cm2.isBeanMap())
136            o = new DelegateBeanMap(((BeanMap)o).getBean(), session).filterKeys(view);
137         else if (cm2.isMap())
138            o = new DelegateMap((Map)o, session).filterKeys(view);
139         else if (cm2.isBean())
140            o = new DelegateBeanMap(o, session).filterKeys(view);
141
142         li.set(o);
143      }
144
145      return l;
146   }
147}
